crag.name: Mull
crag.description: A small and shady crag to the very left of Martinswand. Recommended to those who like it bouldery.

crag.name: Grottenwegwand
crag.description: A crag for those who enjoy a good view. Located at the Kaiser-Max-Grotte, it serves with airy almost vertical routes.

crag.name: Dschungelbuch
crag.description: Without doubt the most famous crag at the Martinswand. Prepare to get smacked by this crimpy dream!

crag.name: ÖAV Klettergarten
crag.description: Always wanted to go icescating in summer? Than this is your crag! However, still got some nice slabs.

crag.name: Alpinmagazin
crag.description: Highlight of this crag are the almost negligent distances between bolts. But we tested it ourself and it turned out safe.

crag.name: Galerie
crag.description: An elegant vertical piece of yellow rock to the right of the Martinswand. This beauty is clearly blessed by the sun.

crag.name: Supermarkt
crag.description: Some compare it with Frankenstein's monster, brought to live against its will. However, got some nice slabs.

crag.name: Kranebitten
crag.description: A special climate with constant high humidity gives this crag a special touch. At least it's shady.

crag.name: Höttinger Steinbruch
crag.description: Due to a famous boulder passage, the first few meters are of a rock quality that lets you consider using a clipstick.
